I answered here: https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/issues/1017

Can you please post on the deeplabcutcore repo if you have issues (https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut-core), and I would ask you first please try colab and be sure it makes sense for you. 

For your second issue, you are trying to use TF2 code within TF1 env: 
```python
File "C:\Users\Administrator\anaconda3\envs\TF1.0\lib\site-packages\deeplabcutcore\pose_estimation_tensorflow\nnet\pose_net.py", line 9, in <module>
    import tensorflow.contrib.slim as slim
```

Yuo can't image how terrible I was. I did it you mentioned in #1017  already.
**pip install git+https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut-core.git@tf2.2alpha
pip install tf_slim**

But when I **import deeplabcutcore as deeplabcut**,the same problem has occurred.

ImportError: cannot import name 'GceClusterResolver' from 'tensorflow.python.distribute.cluster_resolver.gce_cluster_resolver' (C:\Users\Administrator\anaconda3\envs\DLC-GPU\lib\sitepackages\tensorflow\python\distribute\ cluster_resolver\gce_cluster_resolver.py)

Maybe I am not suitable for this.I read the #944 you mentioned.So I update my CUDA to 1.11 and cudnn to 8.0.
When I test in the DLC-GPU with the code **python testscript.py**,this is a problem named **AttributeError: module 'TensorFlow' has no attribute 'logging'**,so I change the tf.logging to tf.compat.v1.logging.After that ,the same problem occurred,**" cannot import name 'GceClusterResolver' from 'tensorflow.python.distribute.cluster_resolver.gce_cluster_resolver' "**.

Maybe is there a singe steps for the deeplabcutcore?

it just sounds like you did not installed deeplabutcore correctly. 

you need to be sure TF 2.x is installed first. 

then run:
```
!pip install git+https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut-core.git@tf2.2alpha
!pip install tf_slim
```
Maybe the reason is that I use the TF-gpu not the Tensorflow. I am sure that Tensorflow-gpu is 2.x.So the deeplabcutcore just is supported by the TF-CPU?

No, it definitely works with GPUs I would urge you to try the colab link as a tes; you just upload your project folder to google drive, the use that notebook as is. At least you will see the code works ;). 

you just need to install `pip install tensorflow==2.3` for example; tf dropped the gpu vs cpu, btw.

In your env: if you do, what version are you using?
```python
import tensorflow 
tensorflow.__version__

```

I find my tensorflow version is 2.2.0,so I change it by **pip install tensorflow==2.3**.
I run it üëç 
    _pip install git+https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut-core.git@tf2.2alpha_
    _pip install tf_slim_
When I run 
   _import tensorflow as tf_ 
the computer tell me **Successfully opened dynamic library cudart64_101.dll**,maybe there is not any mistakes.
However ,when I run
 _import deeplabcutcore as deeplabcut_
the computer tell me **ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'tensorflow.contrib'**
So how can I solve it?The module has removed  in TF2.x.

Hey,I tested the code you mentioned in [colab.research.google.com/github/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut-core/blob/tf2.2alpha/Colab_TrainNetwork_VideoAnalysis_TF2.ipynb#scrollTo=3K9Ndy1beyfG](url),but it  also owns some mistakes,when I run : _import deeplancutcore as deeplabcut_,it told me **ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'deeplabcutcore'**

this 100% works for me (and others): 

https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut-core/blob/tf2.2alpha/Colab_TrainNetwork_VideoAnalysis_TF2.ipynb

VIDEO:

![ezgif com-gif-maker](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28102185/102020957-cda03600-3d7c-11eb-83b5-67b72bdea54f.gif)

I removed the envs and created a new one with  python=3.6
I installed TensorFlow==2.3 and deeplabcutcore
I also installed the branches with
   **pip install pip install git+https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut-core.git@tf2.2alpha**
      **pip install tf_slim**
However when I _import the deeplabcutcore as deeplabcut_ ,it told me **No module named 'tensorflow.contrib'**
Maybe it wants TF1.X?
And then I searched the packages in the envs,I didn't see the cudnn(7.6.5) and cudatoolkit(10.2.89), so I installed them. 
The same ModuleNotFoundError had occurred.Maybe I lacked the deeplabcut? So I installed  deeplabcut==2.2b8. However 
it didn't works again.

issue.title: No module named 'tensorflow.contrib

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
I created a python=3.7 env in Anaconda 3.And then I installed the deeplabcutcore and tf-nightly-gpu==2.5.0.dev20201019(OR TF==2.3).
Maybe I also needed some branches with 
**pip install tf_slim 
pip install git+https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut-core.git@tf2.2alpha**

But the same problems occurred every time:

body:
Oh my god,I am sorry for that.I mistake your meaning.I can use the deeplabcutcore right now!
So how can I label my data?I find that the deeplabcutcore' has no attribute 'label_frames'.

Well,how can I chose the GPU to train when I create my own project?
Thank you so much!!!!!!

You can have the normal `pip install deeplabcut` either in another env, or the same environment to create the project + Label, then use the dlccore alpha branch to create the training set and train, evaluate, and analyze videos.

you're welcome.
Well ,so why don't you add the part of label into the deeplabcutcore?Maybe it is more convenient.

because core is for the docker; which does not have GUI support. We are in the process of splitting the package such that core will be a dependency of dlc. Right now we do not want to force people to use TF2. https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/docs/roadmap.md

Actually for me,the deeplabcutcore is better than deeplabcut. I always stopped at the stage of training my network.I maybe works one time in ten trails.As foe now,I can label my data in deeplabcut and train in deeplabcutcore. Although I don't know how to select the GPU in deeplabcutcore. Just a little slow in the training speed! This is a huge step forward for me! 
I hope the amazing tools can help me a lot in the future research work.

I'm so sorry for disturbing you again. Could you please help me for how to chose a GPU in deeplabcutcore?I trained my network for 2000 in CPU for about 4 hours! I searched on the GitHub and used the code like:
_import os
os.environ["CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES"] = "0"_
But it didn't works.
So what the code do you use?

issue.title: Very slow training with RTX 3090

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
OS: Win 10
CUDA: 11.1
Cudnn: 8.0.5.39 (Installed as described in https://www.reddit.com/r/tensorflow/comments/jsalkw/rtx_3090_and_tensorflow_for_windows_10_step_by/)
Driver:  461.40

Tensorflow: 2.4.0 and deeplabcutcore from https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut-core.git@tf2.2alpha in the quick-install anaconda environment DLC-GPU

Hello everyone,

I tried to train my models with a RTX 3090, but I quickly realized that the regular quick-install deeplabcut wont work anymore. In issue #944 there was a general outline on what to do to start training with deeplabcutcore and I followed these and got it somehow working. My issue now is though, that the above setup allows me to train but is extremely slow when doing so.
I have another setup with Ubuntu 18.04 and a RTX 2080Ti and this is about 5x faster. Is there some issue with the setup I described above that slows the training process down?

During the installation I noticed a few issues:
Just installing deeplabcutcore with pip will (in my case) led to the error that tensorflow.contrib could not be found. This is why I used the 2.2alpha branch with tf_slim, as described in #1024.
Installing the tf-nightly-gpu package will lead to a freeze as soon as I import deeplabcutcore (same installation as above). This is why I used tensorflow 2.4.0.

Can someone who is also using a RTX 3000 card tell me how to properly set this up? I was hoping to speed up the training compared to the other setup.

Thanks in advance for any suggestions you can give!
